title: How is navigation a reason for the age of exploration? - Quora

response.answer_text: Prince Henry the Navigator, Infante of Portugal financed expeditions to find Prester John, a fabled rich Christian king of the southern lands. Another goal was explore beyond Cape Bojador in the Western Sahara. And finally to spread Christianity. He only took a 25% cut of the gross in addition to detailed logs and maps, which his scribes copied and distributed to ship captains. Cape Bojador was the limit of European knowledge. A Venetian expedition had ventured forth and never returned. But in 1432 a Portuguese ship survived to return home. By 1488 they had reached the Cape of Good Hope. By 1498 they reached Calicut India. And by 1513 they had reached Guangzhou China.
